name: Phonemic discrimination
description: Vowel space discrimintation narrows across development. This meta-analysis explore vowel discrimination, including results from behavioral, electrophysiological, and neuroimaging methods applied to infants 0-14 months of age.

name: Word segmentation
description: An analysis of studies on infants' extraction of words from running, natural speech as evidenced in paradigms built on listening times.

name: Pointing
description: The pointing gesture has been argued to be related to the development of language. This meta-analysis explore the relationship between pointing and language development, bother concurrently and longitudinally.

name: Mutual Exclusivity
description: Mutual exclusvity is the bias for children to assume a novel word refers to a novel object, in the presence of one novel and one familiar object.
